Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water and light, showing it as healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that has no water, showing it as wilted or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant that has no light, showing it as wilted or not growing well.
The student can identify and label the parts of the plant that help it take in water and light.
The student can highlight differences in the drawings to show patterns between plants with and without water and light.
The student can use their drawings to explain that plants need water and light to live and grow.
